bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize certain education contracts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-15 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any school district may enter into a contract with another school district, including a school district in another state, for the provision of educational programs or services to its students. Such programs or services may include the use or sharing of teachers, other staff, physical facilities, or other education resources if the teacher, staff member, facility, program, resource, or activity meets all licensing, certification, and approval requirements that apply in the state in which the teacher or staff member is employed or the facilities or resources are located. This section neither authorizes nor precludes contracts or agreements that involve the full-time enrollment of students in schools outside their resident districts. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
